PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
A geraзгo distribuнda com sistemas fotovoltaicos conectados а rede elйtrica vem ocupando cada
vez mais espaзo nas discussхes sobre a inserзгo das energias renovбveis na matriz elйtrica
nacional.Este crescimento possibilitou uma reduзгo significativa no custo de produзгo da energia
elйtrica proveniente dos geradores fotovoltaicos, tornando a geraзгo distribuнda com pequenos
sistemas fotovoltaicos uma alternativa energйtica competitiva, confiбvel e segura para o
fornecimento de energia elйtrica nгo somente аs localidades isoladas e dispersas da rede elйtrica
convencional como tambйm em regiхes urbanas, atravйs dos denominados sistemas fotovoltaicas
conectadas а rede elйtrica (SFCR).Considerar a geraзгo distribuнda no planejamento da expansгo do setor elйtrico pode dar
robustez а matriz energйtica, na medida em que permite o uso de diferentes tecnologias de

conectadas а rede, faz-se necessбrio o desenvolvimento mecanismos de difusгo e capacitaзгo,
despertando o interesse de alunos desde o ensino mйdio atй a pуs-graduaзгo. Nesse sentido,

instalada.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Development of a solar photovoltaic-based system to power aзaн production process in isolated amazon river dweller commuties
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Several river dweller communities in the Amazon Region suffer from the lack of a reliable electrical grid to provide support for several daily applications. In most cases, electrical energy is provided by means of fossil fuel-based thermal generators (usually diesel-operated), thus increasing carbon dioxide emissions to the atmosphere, not only in the electricity generation process, but also during fuel transportation, which is made by boats that also use diesel. Most of the consumption is to power loads used in the aзaн production process. Aзaн is a fruit extracted from palm trees known as Aзaizeiros (Euterpe oleracea), which are very common in the Amazon Region, and an important source of nutrients and income for those communities.
This project intends to develop a solar energy-based battery powered system to supply energy for the aзaн production process, which involves a water pumping and treatment systems, aзaн pulp extraction, and its conservation in a refrigeration unit. Such system will substitute traditional diesel generators, hence significantly contributing to lower carbon dioxide emissions by reducing fossil fuel consumptions. The project plan is to develop a prototype and install and monitor its operation in an isolated household in the proximities of Abaetetuba region in the Brazilian state of Parб. It is expected that such system can be further reproduced for several communities, based on a detailed economic feasibility analysis and by developing public-private partnership agreements.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Diseсo y Validaciуn de la Operaciуn y Monitoreo de Sistemas Fotovoltaicos Conectados a la Red (SFCRs) en Condiciones Extremas del Altiplano sobre los 3800 msnm
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
La generaciуn distribuida con sistemas fotovoltaicos conectados a la red elйctrica viene ocupando cada vez mбs espacio en las discusiones sobre la inserciуn de las energнas renovables en la matriz elйctrica del Perъ. El uso de estos sistemas viene teniendo experiencias de gran crecimiento en varios paнses con climas muy variados y extremos. Este crecimiento permitiу una reducciуn significativa en el costo de producciуn de la energнa elйctrica originado por la generaciуn fotovoltaica, convirtiendo la generaciуn distribuida con pequeсos sistemas fotovoltaicos una alternativa energйtica competitiva, confiable y segura para el proveer de energнa elйctrica no solamente en localidades aisladas y dispersas de la red elйctrica convencional como tambiйn en regiones urbanas, a travйs de los denominados Sistemas Fotovoltaicos Conectados a la Red Elйctrica (SFCRs). A pesar de las ventajas mencionadas de esta tecnologнa, el Perъ no tiene mucha experiencia a la aplicaciуn de SFCRs. Una de las principales barreras para el uso de esta tecnologнa era costo elevado. Pero esta barrera se esta venciendo, ya que es real la reducciуn del costo de los diversos componentes del sistema.. 
Situaзгo: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Energy Resilience: Exploring the cultures, politics and practices of energy access in Amazonia
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project forges an approach to ?Energy Resilience? in off-grid locations through interdisciplinary qualitative and quantitative research working directly with people in Amazon forest communities. Our international research team will bring together knowledge from anthropology, engineering, sociology and geography to develop an analytical and practical approach to everyday resilience through the lens of energy access in light of social, political and cultural realities. In Amazonia, one of the most remote areas of the world, many inhabitants are well adapted to its topographical and environmental challenges, but it is becoming increasingly evident that barriers to energy access have knock-on effects in areas of healthcare, education, democratic participation and equitable access to rights and services. By focusing on the needs, capacities and understandings of communities, this project seeks to empower local people by facilitating greater involvement in development opportunities that recognise the importance of viewing resilience as a way of life.
